name: Solid oxide electrolysis stack; 150 kW, at plant
description: This cradle to gate unit process is for the assembly of a 150 kilowatt (kW) solid oxide electrolysis stack. The original model was based on European data but has been adapted to represent US conditions. Data were originally collected by Schreiber et al., 2020 and have been adapted by the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL). The system boundary of this dataset includes the main incoming materials with transportation but excludes the argon and hydrogen incoming materials that are needed for annealing due to missing data.
category: 31-33: Manufacturing/3359: Other Electrical Equipment and Component Manufacturing

processDocumentation.timeDescription: This unit process is representative of data collected from a study that was published in 2020. This dataset has been adapted recently to reflect US conditions and to allocate flows as needed.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This process is representative of the production of a solid oxide electrolysis stack under US conditions. This study was originally conducted under European conditions but this dataset has been adapted to represent US conditions.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: This process represents the production of one solid oxide electrolysis stack. Incoming materials, transport, and process energy required for assembly are included.
processDocumentation.inventoryMethodDescription: An attributional LCI method was used to develop the dataset.
processDocumentation.modelingConstantsDescription: This process was adapted from Schreiber et al., 2020.
processDocumentation.completenessDescription:
TREATMENT OF MISSING ENVIRONMENTAL DATA: It is unknown whether a cutoff for elementary flows was used in the original study.

TREATMENT OF MISSING TECHNOSPHERE FLOWS: It is unknown whether a cutoff for elementary flows was used in the original study. Missing technosphere flows are unknown.

MASS BALANCE: The mass imbalance for this unit process is unknown.
processDocumentation.dataSelectionDescription: Data for the construction of a solid oxide electrolysis stack was collected and adapted from the original study, Schreiber et al., 2020.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The original model used European incoming datasets, which have been switched to US based incoming datasets in this model. Flows have been adapted and emissions have been calculated for this dataset.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
BOUNDARY CONDITIONS: The system boundary includes upstream burdens from incoming materials and process energy. The production of argon and hydrogen are excluded from the system boundary due to a lack of gas consumption data.

DATA COLLECTION: Data were collected from Schreiber et al., 2020.

UNCERTAINTY ESTIMATION: It is unknown whether an uncertainty estimation was performed.
processDocumentation.dataCollectionDescription: Data were collected from Schreiber et al., 2020.
processDocumentation.intendedApplication: The intended application for this process is for accounting purposes as described in Goal Situation C1 from the ILCD Handbook's Detailed Guidance. LCA studies with this intended application offer "purely descriptive documentation of the system under analysis (e.g., a product, sector or country), without being interested in any potential consequences on other parts of the economy.” The studies categorized under Goal Situation C1 do NOT consider existing benefits outside the analyzed system such as recycling. The target audience of this dataset is LCA practitioners, industry, the general public, and policymakers. This model was originally built for an LCA and was originally developed and analyzed with the ReCiPe and CML2001 impact assessment methods. The completeness of elementary flows is unknown and it is not an update to a previous USLCI dataset.
processDocumentation.projectDescription: This project was funded by NREL.

dataDocumentor.name: Franklin Associates, A Division of ERG

processDocumentation.restrictionsDescription: The intended application for this process is for accounting purposes as described in Goal Situation C1 from the ILCD Handbook's Detailed Guidance. LCA studies with this intended application offer "purely descriptive documentation of the system under analysis (e.g., a product, sector or country), without being interested in any potential consequences on other parts of the economy.” The studies categorized under Goal Situation C1 do NOT consider existing benefits outside the analyzed system such as recycling. The target audience of this dataset is LCA practitioners, industry, the general public, and policymakers. This model was originally built for an LCA and was originally developed and analyzed with the ReCiPe and CML2001 impact assessment methods. The completeness of elementary flows is unknown and it is not an update to a previous USLCI dataset.
